result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie M Gretzon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $9,757.59 to Hanover Insurance Co. and $6,149.58 to K & K Insurance Co.  Restitution is to be paid WITHIN 4 YEARS OF PROBATION and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines as Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Defendant is not to be involved in any employment/volunteer activities that involve management of money.
PAY ALL RESTITUTION.
No contact with New Berlin Soccer Club or the Milwaukee Kickers.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
Defendant to serve FIRST 4 MONTHS.  Defendant to report to Huber by 06:00 p.m. on 04-11-2016.
LAST 5 MONTHS are STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
filed by Attorney Schrio requesting the Court stay defendant's report date to huber.

4/8/16 - Court grants defense request and orders defendant to be released from the jail forthwith and she is to report to Huber by Monday, April 11, 2016 by 6:00 p.m.

Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Melanie M Gretzon in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  
Representative from the Milwaukee Kickers presented a statement to the court.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their setencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  6 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  5 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Not be involved in any employment/volunteer actives that involve management of money.
Payment of Restitution.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  New Berlin Soccer Club or the Milwaukee Kickers.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.


RESTITUTION:  $15,907.17(Breakdown:  $9,757.59 to Hanover Insurance Co. & $6,149.58 to K&K Insurance Co. - restitution to be paid before costs or fines) - to be paid within the first 4 years of probation.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to serve the first 4 month - forthwith.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the WaukeshaCounty Sheriff's Department.
Last 5 Months - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.   

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
